A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This movie was better than the Prequels and yet worse at the same time. How Rian Johnson handled Luke Skywalker is difficult to imagine being worse. The story Rian Johnson has told is barely acceptable if this were just another sci-fi movie\, but it isn't. It's Star Wars. This story needed someone to bring an A+++ story to the table and then tell it really well. That's not what we got. We got a long drawn out attempt at a story. Somehow Disney forgot that this isn't a comedy but should contain humor. They've lost what it means to be heroic and self sacrificing. It doesn't build on what it inherited. It's simply pushing what Star Wars is aside attempting to redefine it in weak confused terms. Poor\, to no\, character development. Too many characters that you just don't care about or even know why they have screen time versus any of the other characters encountered. Sheesh! Dropping bombs in space? We've overlooked the imperfections of the original trilogy because the characters and story were solid and gripping. The actors and actresses performances in this were fantastic\, even if I didn't agree with the character portrayals\, but as a Star Wars film it gets one star. One star for how fantastic the visual effects were and being able to see the Star Wars world once again. I feel so sorry for Mark Hamill!
